brief_summary.textblock:
To investigate the Racecadotril pharmacokinetic linearity after single oral administration
      of 10, 30 and 60 mg as a suspension.

      To evaluate the comparative bioavailability of the new Racecadotril formulation (suspension)
      versus the reference sachet formulation (granules)

clinical_study.brief_title: Racecadotril Suspension Linearity Study & Comparative Bioavailability Versus Granules

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a single center, open-label, single oral dose, 4-period cross-over study to assess
      the bioequivalence of a new formulation (suspension) in healthy male volunteers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy male,

          -  18 to 45 years old,

          -  be certified as normal by a comprehensive clinical assessment (detailed medical
             history and a complete physical examination), arterial blood pressure (BP), heart
             rate (HR), an ECG and laboratory investigations (haematological, blood chemistry
             tests, urinalysis), the results of which are within the normal range and/ or judged
             by the investigator as clinically acceptable for healthy subjects,

          -  Body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 28 kg/m2.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of cardiovascular, pulmonary gastro-intestinal, hepatic, renal, metabolic,
             haematological, neurological, psychiatric, systemic, or infectious disease.

          -  Any other condition which, in the opinion of the Investigator, would jeopardize the
             safety of the subject or impact the validity of the study results.

          -  Subject has used any drug including OTC products two weeks before the scheduled
             administration of study drug, except paracetamol (maximum 1g/day).

intervention.description: Racecadotril suspension at 10, 30 and 60mg. Single oral dose.
Racecadotril granules at 60mg. Single oral dose.

clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Racecadotril Linearity After Single Administrations of 10, 30 and 60 mg of a New Racecadotril Formulation (Suspension) by Oral Route and Evaluation of the Comparative Bioavailability of This New Formulation Versus the Sachet Formulation (Granules) After a 60 mg Single Oral Administration in Healthy Male Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description:
Several blood sample will be collected at each period to investigate the racecadotril pharmacokinetic linearity and to evaluate the comparative bioavalibility.
4-period, cross over, single oral dose at each period.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Total study duration per subject should be 6 weeks.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label
